variants.Description in input context: Tâ†’C transition at position 497 from the ORF start in cDNA, resulting in the substitution of a highly conserved leucine at position 166 (Leu166) of the DJ-1 protein by a proline

Material used.Description: In COS and PC12 cells transfected with wild-type DJ-1 we observed diffuse cytoplasmic and nuclear DJ-1 immunoreactivity.

Readout description.Result Description: Transfection of the DJ-1 carrying the Leu166Pro mutation showed a similar uniform nuclear staining, whereas the cytoplasmic staining appeared mostly colocalized with mitochondria.

Basic positive control.Description: Transfection of cells with wild-type DJ-1.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Diffuse cytoplasmic and nuclear DJ-1 immunoreactivity.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cytoplasmic staining appeared mostly colocalized with mitochondria.
